com.i2group.apollo.searchservice.transport
Enum FilterOperator

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Enum<FilterOperator>
      com.i2group.apollo.searchservice.transport.FilterOperator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<FilterOperator>
public enum FilterOperator
extends Enum<FilterOperator>

Indicates the type of comparison to be performed in a filter operation.

Operations on LogicalTypes whose data type is String are case-insensitive. Also, a sequence of consecutive white space characters is equivalent to a single white space character.

Operations on LogicalTypes whose data type is Calendar perform their comparisons at the level of milliseconds.

Operations on LogicalTypes with other data types proceed as follows:

  • For DECIMAL, BigDecimal.doubleValue() is used for the comparison.
  • For DOUBLE, Double.equals(Object) is used for the comparison.
  • For INTEGER, Integer.equals(Object) is used for the comparison.
  • For BOOLEAN, Boolean.equals(Object) is used for the comparison.

Since:
2.0

Enum Constant Detail

STARTS_WITH

public static final FilterOperator STARTS_WITH
The value of the FilterBasis in this operation starts with the specified value. This operator can be applied to Property values with data types MULTIPLE_LINE_STRING, SINGLE_LINE_STRING, SUGGESTED_FROM, and SELECTED_FROM.

Note: The server places a limit on the length of the strings that the STARTS_WITH operator considers. By default, the limit is 256 characters, but system administrators can change it in the server configuration file.

EQUAL_TO

public static final FilterOperator EQUAL_TO
The value of the FilterBasis in this operation is equal to the specified value. This operator can be applied to Property values with data types BOOLEAN, DECIMAL, DATE, DATE_AND_TIME, DOUBLE, INTEGER, MULTIPLE_LINE_STRING, SINGLE_LINE_STRING, SUGGESTED_FROM, SELECTED_FROM, and TIME. It can also be used in filter operations on CREATED_TIMESTAMPs and MODIFIED_TIMESTAMPs.

Note: The server places a limit on the length of the strings that the EQUAL_TO operator considers. By default, the limit is 256 characters, but system administrators can change it in the server configuration file.

GREATER_THAN

public static final FilterOperator GREATER_THAN
The value of the FilterBasis in this operation is greater than the specified value. This operator can be applied to Property values with data types DECIMAL, DATE, DATE_AND_TIME, DOUBLE, INTEGER, and TIME. It can also be used in filter operations on CREATED_TIMESTAMPs and MODIFIED_TIMESTAMPs.

GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO

public static final FilterOperator GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
The value of the FilterBasis in this operation is greater than or equal to the specified value. This operator can be applied to Property values with data types DATE, DATE_AND_TIME, DECIMAL, DOUBLE, INTEGER, and TIME. It can also be used in filter operations on CREATED_TIMESTAMPs and MODIFIED_TIMESTAMPs.

LESS_THAN

public static final FilterOperator LESS_THAN
The value of the FilterBasis in this operation is less than the specified value. This operator can be applied to Property values with data types DATE, DATE_AND_TIME, DECIMAL, DOUBLE, INTEGER, and TIME. It can also be used in filter operations on CREATED_TIMESTAMPs and MODIFIED_TIMESTAMPs.

LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO

public static final FilterOperator LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
The value of the FilterBasis in this operation is less than or equal to the specified value. This operator can be applied to Property values with data types DATE, DATE_AND_TIME, DECIMAL, DOUBLE, INTEGER, and TIME. It can also be used in filter operations on CREATED_TIMESTAMPs and MODIFIED_TIMESTAMPs.

BETWEEN

public static final FilterOperator BETWEEN
The value of the FilterBasis in this operation lies between (or is one of) the specified values. This operator can be applied to Property values with data types DATE, DATE_AND_TIME, DECIMAL, DOUBLE, INTEGER, and TIME. It can also be used in filter operations on CREATED_TIMESTAMPs and MODIFIED_TIMESTAMPs.

SMART_MATCH

public static final FilterOperator SMART_MATCH
The value of the FilterBasis in this operation is a fuzzy match for the specified value. This operator can be applied to Property values with data types MULTIPLE_LINE_STRING, SINGLE_LINE_STRING, SUGGESTED_FROM, and SELECTED_FROM.
